summary:
Thanks to the privilege of the experiences build over the past few years, traveling (mostly solo) to different sides of the world and having had the opportunity to live in different countries have shaped me into the independent and strong person I am today. 
Events which have added to my character - responsible, organised, passionate and confident are some of the associated adjectives - which have thereby made me highly adaptable to changing situations and shifting environments.
Additionally, I am very passionate about the natural world, one of the drivers behind the choice of my studies in environmental sciences and biology as well as that of making conscious decisions in my lifestyle. Most of all, I am an ocean lover, thus deeply enjoying actives such as surfing, free diving and scuba diving (currently holding a Divemasters qualification with 175 dives on my logbook). 
Further, I have combined my above mentioned experience and passions into creative work as photographer, freelance writer, illustrator and graphic designer. A way for me to share what so dear to me with these around me: www.demikerkhof.com and @thedancinganemone.

education.field_of_study: Future Planet Studies with a major in Biology

profile_positions.description:
Studio Anemone approaches each project with unique perspectives, to match the appropriate problem solving required for each individual case. This to find creative, long lasting solutions for diverse questions and problems, not only to cater for the need of the clients but also to be mindful of the requirements and behaviours of the costumer base.

Studio Anemone is active in the field of: branding and brand identities, concept development, web design, logo design and illustrations, as well as developing elements such as packaging, signage and products for both digital distribution and print. 

Studio Anemone works independently or together with a team of creatives.

Always open for new projects and connections!
profile_positions.title: Freelance Graphic Designer

profile_positions.description: I have been working an volunteering for Blu Spring Associazione a non-for-profit organisation based in Switzerland and operating in Zambia. The following, have been concentrated on humanitarian work, in the developing country of Zambia. I have actively been working with the organisation for three years filling different positions such as: web designer, photographer, documentary maker and the gathering of data for future research. Since 2021 I am part of the board of directors.
profile_positions.title: Board member and Social Media Coordinator

profile_positions.location: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
profile_positions.description: Team Member and Special Operations Executive at Atlas Label - Due to the outbreak of Covid-19 this position is currently performed remotely
profile_positions.title: Team Member and Special Operations Executive

profile_positions.description: Bachelor thesis internship at Wageningen University. The position filled as research assistant for the Sweet Water Ecology Department. The research was focused on the observations of the larval behaviour and distribution of Aedes cinereus (a species of mosquito) and the validation of funnel traps for sampling. The study was conducted both in the field and in the lab, developing research and data analysis competencies, valuable for future academic employment. The research conducted and resulting paper where of considerable significance for the broader research conducted by the department.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.description: Different tasks were filled during this period. Mainly including the gathering of data and information, using scuba diving and freediving, regarding key species such as: manta rays, whale sharks, small-eye sting rays, humpback whales and dolphins. The latter included photo identification and behavioural analysis in correlation to dive truism. Moreover I performed my own research using a RUV system (remote underwater video) for reef monitoring purposes. The latter focused on a preliminary assessment of the fish diversity and abundance on three shallow dive sites in the Tofo Marine Area. Additionally we were also asked to give weekly talks about marine megafauna to the public and to local groups to inform them about the importance of marine life and the different ecosystems. Through this internship, I developed many qualities that have helped me along my academic career as well as personal life. Some include the gathering and analysing of scientific data, working in a big international and intercultural team, public speaking in front of big groups and living in a remote area. The data gathered during the internship and the report written have been of considerable use for the population research and monitoring studies the organisation is and has been conducting.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant
